description: A five-slide presentation with key information about Tennis.
title: All About Tennis

slides.title: Introduction to Tennis
slides.content: Tennis is a racket sport played individually against a single opponent (singles) or between two teams of two players each (doubles). Players use a strung racket to strike a hollow rubber ball covered with felt over a net into the opponent's court. The objective is to hit the ball in such a way that the opponent cannot play a valid return.

slides.title: History and Origins
content: Tennis originated in 12th century France as 'jeu de paume' (game of the palm), played with bare hands.
The modern game evolved in England in the 1870s with the establishment of the first tennis club in Leamington Spa.
Major Walter Clopton Wingfield patented the game in 1874, calling it 'Sphairistik√®' before it became known as lawn tennis.
The first Wimbledon Championship was held in 1877, making it the oldest tennis tournament in the world.

slides.title: Rules and Scoring
content: A standard match consists of the best of three or five sets, with each set won by the first player to win 6 games with a 2-game advantage.
Scoring system is unique: 0 (love), 15, 30, 40, game. To win a game, a player must win at least 4 points with a 2-point advantage.
The court is divided by a net, with service boxes on each side. Players serve alternately from behind the baseline.
The ball must land within the court boundaries, and players lose a point if they fail to return the ball properly.

slides.title: Famous Players and Records
content: Roger Federer (Switzerland) has won 20 Grand Slam singles titles, including 8 Wimbledon championships.
Serena Williams (USA) is considered one of the greatest female players ever, with 23 Grand Slam singles titles.
Rafael Nadal (Spain) holds the record for most French Open titles (14) and is known for his dominance on clay courts.
Martina Navratilova won 18 Grand Slam singles titles and is regarded as one of the best female players in tennis history.

slides.title: Tournaments and Impact
content: The four Grand Slam tournaments are: Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open.
Tennis is played at the Olympic Games, with singles and doubles events for both men and women.
Professional tours include ATP (men's) and WTA (women's) with year-end championships for top players.
Tennis has become a global sport with millions of recreational players and professional prize money exceeding $200 million annually.
